title: stuck on erigon version 2022.07.2-alpha-c7a94eee with no error messages
body:

In your logs i see that you are fine. Where do you see stuck?

> In your logs i see that you are fine. Where do you see stuck?

The log doesn't scroll anymore, after 90 minutes, I check log again, it still here.
> > In your logs i see that you are fine. Where do you see stuck? > > The log doesn't scroll anymore, after 90 minutes, I check log again, it still here.

Wow. Can you try: 
pkill -SIGUSR1 erigon
> yes, i try to restart erigon docker, it will sync block again, but it will stuck again in about 25 minutes.

@AskAlexSharov  same question, It also blocks rpc requests,  i use erigon's built-in http

> @du5 Can you try: pkill -SIGUSR1 erigon

same as https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/4718#issuecomment-1185332172
I had to restart erigon frequently to keep the rpc working,ðŸ˜­ðŸ˜­

@du5 there is no output from pkill in this screenshot, it prints goroutines.
Though, some good news is that if you try the latest develop version the bug might go away. Try and let me know how it goes.

> @du5 there is no output from pkill in this screenshot, it prints goroutines. Though, some good news is that if you try the latest develop version the bug might go away. Try and let me know how it goes.

I just met the similar issue, my rpcdaemon and erigon core are running in different pods, when the erigon core stuck I caught a pprof for it and it shows during the stuck most of the cpu time is on gc:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4777457/184293955-2e584964-9016-4c60-b07f-e4147c2c6216.png)
I'll close this - let's reopen against a newer version if the issue still persists. :)
